text:
First of all, its a great tool and it may help us immensely during dev and 
testing phase.

However there are no debug info available when something goes wrong.
I created a JDBC request, and tried running it, It neither showed me success
or failure there were no error log files even after setting -LDEBUG flag.
Finally after 2 hours I found that there was typo in jdbc url.

It would be extremely helpful had there been a functioing error log.
creator: vsubrama@lehman.com
sebb@apache.org
text:
By default, errors and debug messages are written to the file jmeter.log in 
the bin directory. 

The log file also shows summary information about JMeter and the test that is 
being run.

Did this not have any useful information in it?

If not, please post some details so that the problem can be replicated.

For HTTP test cases this is fine.
But for JDBC testing the jmeter.log does not have sufficient info debugging the
problem.

Set up a JDBC test. Type in a wrong JDBC URL or JDBC class driver, the error
log will not tell you whats wrong. 

Even after setting the DEBUG flag nothing is shown. Ideazlly when the debug 
flag is turned on all the traffic back and forth including exceptions caught 
by JMETER could be logged. 
This would greatly improve debugging in case of any problem abd would
greatly enhance the usability of otherwise a useful tool.

Regards
 V Subramani
Lehman Brothers
creator: vsubrama@lehman.com
sebb@apache.org
text:
Well, I get messages in the jmeter.log file if the class cannot be found, or 
the database is not running.

For example when I mistyped the classname:

03/09/2004 9:24:13 PM ERROR - jmeter.protocol.jdbc:  
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.mysql.jdbc.Driverxxx

And when the database was not running:

03/09/2004 9:25:14 PM ERROR - jmeter.protocol.jdbc: Couldn't open connections 
to database java.sql.SQLException: Unable to connect to any hosts due to 
exception: java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect

==

It would be useful if the View Result Tree showed some detail if an error 
occurs, and some debug output would also be useful. I'll see about adding 
these in due course.
